Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp

package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp
SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) server implementation.

This package provides a full-featured SMTP server for receiving email, with support for modern extensions including STARTTLS, authentication, and message size limits.

Staged Handler Pattern

The SMTP server uses a staged handler pattern that guides implementers through the protocol flow with type-safe interfaces. Each stage provides only the operations valid for that protocol state, making out-of-order responses impossible at compile time.

Handler Interfaces (what you implement)

  • ClientConnected - Entry point for new connections
  • HelloHandler - Receives HELO/EHLO, STARTTLS, AUTH
  • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.handler.PostTlsHandler - Receives post-STARTTLS EHLO
  • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.handler.AuthResponseHandler - Receives SASL auth responses
  • MailFromHandler - Receives MAIL FROM commands
  • RecipientHandler - Receives RCPT TO, DATA/BDAT
  • MessageDataHandler - Receives message completion

State Interfaces (provided by SMTPConnection)

  • ConnectedState - Accept/reject connection
  • HelloState - Accept/reject greeting
  • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.handler.StarttlsState - Accept/reject TLS upgrade
  • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.handler.AuthState - Auth challenge/success/failure
  • MailFromState - Accept/reject sender
  • RecipientState - Accept/reject recipient
  • MessageStartState - Accept/reject message start
  • MessageEndState - Accept/reject message
  • ResetState - Handle RSET

Example Handler


 public class MyMailHandler implements ClientConnected, HelloHandler, 
                                        MailFromHandler, RecipientHandler,
                                        MessageDataHandler {
     
     public void connected(ConnectionInfo info, ConnectedState state) {
         state.acceptConnection("mail.example.com ESMTP", this);
     }
     
     public void hello(boolean extended, String hostname, HelloState state) {
         state.acceptHello(this);  // transitions to MailFromHandler
     }
     
     public void mailFrom(EmailAddress sender, boolean smtputf8,
                          DeliveryRequirements delivery, MailFromState state) {
         state.acceptSender(this);  // transitions to RecipientHandler
     }
     
     public void rcptTo(EmailAddress recipient, RecipientState state) {
         state.acceptRecipient(this);
     }
     
     public void startMessage(MessageStartState state) {
         state.acceptMessage(this);  // transitions to MessageDataHandler
     }
     
     public void messageComplete(MessageEndState state) {
         state.acceptMessageDelivery("queued-123", this);
     }
     
     // Other required methods...
 }

Key Components

  • SMTPServer - The main SMTP server that accepts incoming connections
  • SMTPConnection - Handles a single SMTP session and command processing
  • ClientConnectedFactory - Factory for creating per-session handlers
  • SMTPPipeline - Generic interface for message processing pipelines

Pipeline Architecture

Gumdrop provides a pipeline mechanism for processing messages as they stream through the SMTP server. The SMTPPipeline interface allows pluggable processing without modifying core SMTP code: 


 public interface SMTPPipeline {
     void mailFrom(EmailAddress sender);
     void rcptTo(EmailAddress recipient);
     WritableByteChannel getMessageChannel();  // or null
     void endData();
     void reset();
 }

The pipeline is obtained from MailFromHandler.getPipeline() when a sender is accepted. SMTPConnection automatically:

  • Calls mailFrom() when sender is accepted
  • Calls rcptTo() for each accepted recipient
  • Writes raw message bytes to the channel returned by getMessageChannel()
  • Calls endData() when the message is complete
  • Calls reset() on RSET or connection close

This enables various processing pipelines such as:

  • Email authentication (SPF, DKIM, DMARC) - see AuthPipeline
  • Content filtering and virus scanning
  • Message archiving and journaling
  • Rate limiting and quota enforcement

SMTP Extensions Supported

  • STARTTLS (RFC 3207) - Upgrade to TLS encryption
  • AUTH (RFC 4954) - SASL authentication
  • SIZE (RFC 1870) - Message size declaration
  • 8BITMIME (RFC 6152) - 8-bit MIME transport
  • SMTPUTF8 (RFC 6531) - Internationalized email addresses and headers
  • PIPELINING (RFC 2920) - Command pipelining
  • CHUNKING (RFC 3030) - BDAT command for chunked content transfer
  • BINARYMIME (RFC 3030) - Binary message content (requires BDAT)
  • ENHANCEDSTATUSCODES (RFC 2034) - Enhanced status codes
  • DSN (RFC 3461) - Delivery Status Notifications
  • LIMITS (RFC 9422) - Advertise recipient and transaction limits
  • REQUIRETLS (RFC 8689) - Require TLS for message transmission
  • MT-PRIORITY (RFC 6710) - Message transfer priority
  • FUTURERELEASE (RFC 4865) - Hold message for future delivery
  • DELIVERBY (RFC 2852) - Delivery deadline specification
  • XCLIENT (Postfix) - Proxy protocol for passing original client info

Delivery Requirements

Several extensions allow senders to specify delivery requirements that handlers must respect when relaying messages. These are collected in the DeliveryRequirements interface:

  • REQUIRETLS - Message must only traverse TLS connections
  • MT-PRIORITY - Relative priority (-9 lowest to +9 highest)
  • FUTURERELEASE - Hold until specified time (HOLDFOR/HOLDUNTIL)
  • DELIVERBY - Delivery deadline with return/notify action
  • DSN envelope - Return type (RET) and envelope ID (ENVID)

Configuration Example


 <realm id="mailRealm" class="org.bluezoo.gumdrop.auth.BasicRealm">
   <property name="href">mail-users.xml</property>
 </realm>

 <smtp-handler-factory id="smtpHandler" class="com.example.MySmtpHandlerFactory">
   <property name="queue-dir">/var/spool/mail</property>
 </smtp-handler-factory>

 <server id="smtp" class="org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.SMTPServer">
   <property name="port">25</property>
   <property name="realm" ref="#mailRealm"/>
   <property name="handler-factory" ref="#smtpHandler"/>
   <property name="keystore-file">server.p12</property>
   <property name="keystore-pass">changeit</property>
 </server>

Security

  • TLS encryption via STARTTLS or implicit TLS (port 465)
  • SASL authentication (PLAIN, LOGIN, CRAM-MD5, etc.)
  • Rate limiting for protection against abuse

Email Authentication

The org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.auth subpackage provides asynchronous implementations of SPF, DKIM, and DMARC validation through AuthPipeline:

  • SPF (RFC 7208) - Sender Policy Framework validation
  • DKIM (RFC 6376) - DomainKeys Identified Mail signature verification
  • DMARC (RFC 7489) - Domain-based Message Authentication policy

The authentication pipeline integrates seamlessly - handlers register callbacks for each check type and receive results at the appropriate time (SPF at MAIL FROM, DKIM/DMARC at end-of-data).
